112.content:
Sam was angry with Danny for siding with Tucker when she was able to convince the school board to change the menu. She knew Tucker would disagree from the start, since he loved meat, but she was still mad at Danny for not siding with her.

When Danny called their lunch "garbage", she made up her mind that he would regret insulting her new menu.

"That's it!" yelled Sam at Danny and Tucker. "You two are supposed to be my best friends and yet here you are, calling the menu garbage."

"But it is garbage", said Tucker. "Right, Danny?"

"Right."

"If that's how you feel, then our friendship is over." Sam then stood up and left the cafeteria.

Danny felt bad bout making Sam angry, but Tucker didn't seem upset because he in tun was very angry with Sam.

"I think we should apologize, Tucker."

"You do it if you want to, but I'm not. She got rid of meat on the menu. I don't know if I can get over that so quickly."

"Well, I'm going anyway." Danny then stood up and left the cafeteria in search of Sam. He eventually found her in an empty classroom, eating her lunch with an angry face.

Danny sighed and knocked on the side of the door to get Sam's attention.

"Sam, I'm sorry about earlier. I didn't mean to make you mad. Can you please forgive me?" asked Danny as he walked into the room.

"I don't know, Danny. Are you going to keep calling my menu garbage? And what does Tucker say?"

"I'll try not to. And Tucker's still mad; he doesn't want to apologize."

Sam glared at Danny. "You'll try? You come to ask my forgiveness and you come up with this lame apology attempt."

"What else am I supposed to do to get you to forgive me?"

141.content:
Now that Dani Phantom no longer had to worry about being destabilized, she was feeling better than ever. However, she was upset with the person that she was cloned from, Danny Fenton. She was thinking back to the end of their latest battle with Vlad, when she, Danny, and Valerie were up in the air.

"Thank you both for helping me get stabilized!" said Dani.

"You're welcome," said Valerie.

"I guess you'll be heading out now," added Danny.

"Well, I was actually thinking about staying around for a while. There's a lot of ghosts around. I was wondering if I could stay and help you?"

"No thank you, Dani. I got it all covered. I don't need you as a sidekick."

"How can you say something so mean? I'm lonely out there by myself and now you're disregarding me, too? I thought you were better than that!" yelled Dani as she flew off in anger.

"I'm disapointed in you, Phantom. Dani is a wonderful girl. She could more than easily fill your shoes," said Valerie as she flew away.

As Dani was thinking about the conversation she had not too along ago with Danny, she wanted to get back at him. 'Just because I'm his clone, it doesn't mean I'm inferior to him. I may be younger, but I was born as a half ghost/half human while Danny has spent most of his life as a full human. That has to count for something, right? He thinks he's such a bigshot, but he has help from Sam, Tucker, and his parents' inventions to help him out all the time. I'll prove to Danny that I'm the better half ghost and maybe if I'm generous enough, I'll let him become my sidekick.'

1551322.content:
Desiree laughed to herself as she floated at the edge of Amity Park. Many weeks ago, she escaped the Ghost Zone and managed to evade the capture of the ghostboy. She has flown all over the world with a goal in mind, and now she had campleted it.

She tore her gaze from the town and looked to the in her hands: the Reality Gauntlet. The ghost boy thought he destroyed it, but an ancient artifact like this can not simply be blasted away. It was merely scattered into pieces.

But now she had gathered them all and all the jewels that go with it. And with it she will finaly gain everything she desires. "And the ghost boy shall get what he deserves."

She put the gauntlet on and felt a surge of power go through her body. She had always loved the feeling of power. Looking at the atrifact, she realised it clashed with her tastes, so she decided to give it a bit of a test run by changing it's design.

She snapped her fingers, and the gantlet began to morph and change. Once it was done, it had become a beautiful necklace around her neck. She smiled wickedly at the result, and looked back at the most haunted city in America.

"I'm coming for you, ghost boy."

info.description:
Rules:

1. No males dominate Danny.
2. Give each chapter a decent size. Exceptions are the setup chapters.
3. Give decent grammar. It doesn't have to be perfect, but have it legible.
4. Try not to end a story too short. Keep the stories ongoing as long as you can.
5. Go wild on fetishes.
6. Don't kill Danny.

If I need to add any more rules, I will. But other than that, have fun!
